title: EastEnders star Lisa Hammond on the TV roles she turned down: 'I try not to perpetuate stereotypes' - EastEnders Soaps -
text: EastEnders star Lisa Hammond has spoken about her career choices, revealing that she has often turned down roles that perpetuate negative stereotypes.Hammond, who plays disabled character Donna Yates on the BBC One show, said that she would prefer to take on roles that focus on character rather than disability. © BBC / Kieron McCarron EastEnders star Lisa Hammond: 'I've been shouted at over my wheelchair'Speaking on ITV's Lorraine, Hammond said: "I think all actors can get sidelined and pigeon-holed into certain roles... I try not to do roles that perpetuate what I would imagine is a bad stereotype in terms of smallness or disability."She added: "I want to do creative stories that say more about who the character is, rather than just always focusing on the issues."
